alert.note: Alert for Broward; Collier; Glades; Hendry; Mainland Monroe; Miami-Dade; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 26 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE OVER SOUTH FLORIDA THIS MEMORIAL DAY WEEKEND... A weak cold front will be stalling out over the Central Florida region this Memorial Day Weekend, as a mid to upper level low develop over the Eastern Gulf and moves slowly eastward across the Florida Peninsula. This weather pattern will allow for deep tropical moisture to work into South Florida from the Tropics leading to some heavy rainfall with the strongest showers and thunderstorms each day. The best areas that could see the heavy rainfall will be over the interior areas where the sea breezes collide each day. Rainfall totals of 2 to 3 inches are forecast over the interior areas with 1 to 2 inches over the metro areas of South Florida through this Memorial Day weekend. However, there could be some isolated areas that could see higher amounts of rainfall where showers and thunderstorms develop each day over the same area. Interests across all of South Florida are strongly encouraged to monitor the latest information from the National Weather Service in Miami, Florida through this Memorial Day weekend.
